t: Proverbs 24
Precepts and Warnings
Do*pn not be envious of evil men, Nor*ln desire to be with them;
For*ln their minds devise violence, And*ln their lips talk of trouble.
By*ln wisdom a house is built, And*ln by understanding it is established;
And*ln by knowledge the rooms are filled With*ln all precious and pleasant riches.
A*ln wise man is strong, And*ln a man of knowledge increases power.
For*ln by wise guidance you will wage war, And*ln in abundance of counselors there is victory.
Wisdom*ln is too*i exalted for a fool, He*ln does not open his mouth in the gate.
One*ln who plans to do evil, Men*ln will call a schemer.
The*ln devising of folly is sin, And*ln the scoffer is an abomination to men.
If*ln you are slack in the day of distress, Your*ln strength is limited.
Deliver*ln those who are being taken away to death, And*ln those who are staggering to slaughter, Oh hold them*i back.

If*ln you say, “See, we did not know this,” Does*ln He not consider it*i who weighs the hearts? And*ln does He not know it*i who keeps your soul? And*ln will He not render to man according to his work?
My*ln son, eat honey, for it is good, Yes,*ln the honey from the comb is sweet to your taste;
Know*ln that*i wisdom is thus for your soul; If*ln you find it,*i then there will be a future, And*ln your hope will not be cut off.
Do*ln not lie in wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; Do*ln not destroy his resting place;
For*ln a righteous man falls seven times, and rises again, But*ln the wicked stumble in time*i of*i calamity.
Do*ln not rejoice when your enemy falls, And*ln do not let your heart be glad when he stumbles;
Or*ln the Lord*s will see it*i and be displeased, And*ln turn His anger away from him.
Do*ln not fret because of evildoers Or*ln be envious of the wicked;
For*ln there will be no future for the evil man; The*ln lamp of the wicked will be put out.
My*ln son, fear the Lord*s and the king; Do*ln not associate with those who are given to change,
For*ln their calamity will rise suddenly, And*ln who knows the ruin that*i comes*i from both of them?
These*ln also are sayings of the wise. To*ln show partiality in judgment is not good.
He*ln who says to the wicked, “You are righteous,” Peoples*ln will curse him, nations will abhor him;
But*ln to those who rebuke the wicked*i will be delight, And*ln a good blessing will come upon them.
He*ln kisses the lips Who*ln gives a right answer.
Prepare*ln your work outside And*ln make it ready for yourself in the field; Afterwards,*ln then, build your house.
Do*ln not be a witness against your neighbor without cause, And*ln do not deceive with your lips.
Do*ln not say, “Thus I shall do to him as he has done to me; I*ln will render to the man according to his work.”
I*ln passed by the field of the sluggard And*ln by the vineyard of the man lacking sense,
And*ln behold, it was completely overgrown with thistles; Its*ln surface was covered with nettles, And*ln its stone wall was broken down.
When*ln I saw, I reflected upon it; I*ln looked, and*i received instruction.
“A*ln little sleep, a little slumber, A*ln little folding of the hands to rest,”
Then*ln your poverty will come as*i a robber And*ln your want like an armed man.
